channel.title: Posts on Wilson's Random Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Wilson's Random Notes

item.title: Llama 2 Inferencing Basics
item.description: Getting to “Hello World” The world of LLM is a wild. Getting a prompt from OpenAI or trying demos on HuggingFace is easy but I need to run things on my own, following the playbook of Replicate, modify, innovate, first on my own hardware, then on google colab, and eventually on my own AWS/Google Cloud instance. After the basics, I proceed to think about devops and mlops. The ML terminology in the eyes of non-ML person

item.title: Launching a Shell/Terminal for Google Colab
item.description: Google Colab is basically a web GUI in front of a full-container on Linux. While you can run shell command one by one, it is not easy to run commands interactively. We can use tmate to help get a full shell. You can get the shell access if you pay for higher level Google Colab plans. With this tip, you can get that for free. How Add a code block with following

item.title: Gmail Mark All as Read
item.description: Too many un-read Gmail messages My gmail pertutually contains thousand of unread messages. Most of them are low signal but I don’t have a quick (enough) to mark all as read. My old method was to Create a earch filter like https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#search/label%3Aunread Select-all threads, and then … and then “Mark all as read” Sometimes, you can expand the selection to all if there are paginations Keyboard Shortcuts This is too slow, so I looked up Gmail keyboard shortcuts

item.title: Setting up this site with Hugo and Github
item.description: Inspired by Lillian’s blog I came across Lillian Weng’s ML Blog and enjoyed the style a lot so I decided to create a page to keep track of random note-worthy stuff I ran into withe same Hugo tool. Why do I like this Clean style Markdown based Github to track changes Github Pages for free hosting Streamlined publishing workflow (commit -> push -> publish) with Github Action. How I work on a Mac, assuming git is already install.
